I took a peak at the drink menu and both beer and wine were very cheap. I see myself returning without a doubt. The staff carries a sense of humor and you will definitely be entertained.
author: Jen B.

description: I moved to San Diego after living two blocks from Marios and I crave it every day.  Hands down the best meatball sandwich EVER!!!  Go there and order it, you won't regret it.
author: Geoff W.

description: The view is awesome!  I always have the panni and a house wine!  This place is so laid back perfect for unwinding.  I love to wander in the owner is always nice.  I love to bring my friends from out of town here.  It makes such a nice impression.
author: Dave D.

description: Go there and try the canneloni.  It takes a few minutes, but when they pull it out of the oven, you'll be the envy of the place.
author: Rego S.

description: Mmmm.  Delicious foccacia sandwiches, unlike any I've had elsewhere.  Plus a great view of Washington square park, a bar to sit at if you're by yourself, and usually friendly staff.
author: Rose Q.

description: Damn this spot is great. I suggest the Foccacia sammies or the tukrey and blue cheese panini and or the tomatoe mozzarella. My boyfriend eats two freakin sandwiches, which I cant even believe, But imt telling you, its ridiculously bomb and worth getting a parking ticket!! Great on a sunny day, or a " you just slept at my house, I dont really know you, but, eh, I wanna see what you are REALLY like," brunch
author: Liz C.

description: Great quick food. Authentic tasty Italian food and totally delicious focaccia sandwiches. This is a great stop for before a show at Bimbo's or before the bar run or even on a quick lunch.
author: Natasha M.

description: Food here is really good (tried both the chicken and meatball focaccia sandwiches) and service is friendly.  I still have a problem paying $5 for a bottle of Stella but hey, we are in North Beach.  Good spot for a quick bite before a night of drinking (that focaccia bread can really soak up some alcohol!)
author: phil h.

description: I'm 35, I've had my share of Meatball sandwiches during my life.  This is by far the best Meatball sandwich I have ever had.  I live in Chicago, 2,135 miles from Marios, its rough.  By the way, they have the smallest bathroom ever, its crazy.
author: Benjamin R.

description:
great little place to come for coffee, drinks, and eats.  the staff is kooky and fun and the grilled focaccia sandwiches are delicious!!! (the cheese pizza was just okay). 
for a casual meal i enjoy this place more than most of the restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: arielle n.

description: Cool spot, cool area, friendly, on-the-ball service and good food. Definitely worth a visit if youre nearby or on a regular basis if you live close.
author: David V.

description: This is one of my favorite hang out spots in NB. Their sando's are made with love and they use  focaccia bread made down the street which is just awesome. The place is pretty small inside but it's fun to just sit at the bar and have a glass of wine and a delish caprese salad. To be honest their wine isn't anything to write home about hence the 4 stars, but it's reasonably priced and taste's decent.
author: Kristy M.

description: Damn good.  And lots of personality, too.  Probably the best Eggplant Parmagiana Foccacia sandwich I've had.  Lovely room.  Great staff.
author: Eric H.

description: Pretty good sandwiches, a little touristy-feeling, and a little too pricey for the food you're buying. Not bad... just not somewhere I plan to visit often when there are so many better options in N.Beach.
author: Ryan L.

description: A historic boho bar and sandwich joint perfectly located across from Washington Park and St. Peter and Paul's church. A great place for an afternoon break in North Beach.
author: E C.

description: Cute little spot. My friends brought me here to show me one of their old hangouts  from "back in the day". Mario's struck me as the stereotypical North Beach cafe in a positive way. You can come here and grab an espresso or a beer and kick back while enjoying a relaxing environment. It struck me as a good meeting place for friends. It has a pleasant environment with a  few frills and no fuss.  They're located right across from Washington Park so there's a lot going on if you're a people watcher like me. I wouldn't say you should go out of your way to visit this place but it's a great spot to stop in when you're in the area.
author: chelsea b.

description: Went back to Mario's and am happy to report that it's still awesome. I have yet to find better foccacia bread in the city and forgot to mention my delight over the peppercinis that come with each sandwich. Delicious. I also enjoy the camaraderie between the staff members. Love this place!
author: Angela M.

description: Great place for a quick bite - really good friendly service, good and simple food, and absolutely terrific hot focaccia sandwiches.  A great place to head if you just want a simple place to grab lunch or dinner
author: Jonathan D.

description: Good food, not great when I was there, but the prices are fair.  Nice location next to the park. Drinking a soju on the rocks was my favorite course of the meal :)
author: P H I L H.

description: Their sandwiches are soo filling! You can eat half and you will already be SUPER filled. This isn't a cigar store, I do not know why they even call it that. I think this place is really old because the place looks quite old. The staff was really nice, a lot of recommendations from them. The place is quite small and the tables are too. Their pizzas are good! Thin crust, I wished they would put more cheese. The food that I orders seem to take quite a long time to come!!
author: Janet Z.

description: I have a weakness for focaccia sandwiches and funky cafe names, and Mario's does not disappoint.  Order the grilled chicken #1 (especially if you like dijon mustard), grab the Onion paper off the counter, and enjoy one of those rare sunny San Francisco days.
author: Yasmine G.

description: I'm about to leave North Beach after a year here, so it's time to write a review of my favorite corner cafe.  Mario's has provided that perfect North Beach feeling for me: sitting on a street corner with my son, having excellent food, and watching people go by.  I always get the same: a caprese, a balsamic chicken oven-baked foccacia sandwich (chicken #2), and a glass of vermentino (or a cappuccino if I need the caffeine).  The caprese is good, though I'd prefer better tomatoes.  But the oven-baked balsamic chicken is amazing: moist and tender, smoky flavor, light touch on the balsamic, with good greens, tomato, and feta.  Funky vermentino by the glass is nice as well.  I'll miss this place.
author: Emil A.

description: Nothing too fancy at this place.  Just delicious grilled panini accompanied by great beers on tap and an authentic old school vibe.  What more could you ask for?
author: Erica G.

description: Best focaccia sandwich ever, hands down. I go with the meatball every time. Also, best cappuccino in the city. I've been going here as long as I can remember, and have only ever had amazing things to say about it. Everyone I bring here can't stop thanking me for introducing them, 'nuff said. Friendly service, AMAZING food, reasonable price, good music, good atmosphere. Did I miss anything?
author: Tobias S.

description: The food didn't thrill me, it was unfortunatly bland and ordinary.  Despite the fact it was almost empty, i was still left waiting for my food for ages.  I know this place has quite a reputation, but i'm not going to come back.
author: Herbert S.

description: Quaint, friendly, and unpretentious atmosphere with fresh, olive-oily focaccia. Neither the sandwiches nor the people-watching will disappoint. It's almost a small piece of Europe within San Francisco -- fortunately without the smoking.
author: Surely I Am C.

description: Damn good lasagna!  This is a quaint restaurant/ bar that's no frills, but in a good way.  It's quiet enough to actually have a conversation in this joint, yet not quiet in a boring way.  The server/bartender was really nice.  And, when my dumb ass left the restaurant, forgetting my credit card on the table, he ran outside to give it to me.  Now that's good service.
author: Sarah F.

description: Mario's sandwiches, selection and service has been on a downward slide for a couple of years now.  Their formerly nice selection of ports has been narrowed to "tawny" and "red" - one of each.  The last four sandwiches I've ordered there have been served either over or under cooked, and staff is careless.  Sad to see the old place slide.  Hoping they can reverse the trend.
author: H.A. ..

description: The sandwiches are unbelievable here!  I am a fan of heated sandwiches, and Mario's has an oven similar to a pizza oven that they use to heat the sandwiches.  The service is always quick and courteous.  The location couldn't be better.  I do enjoy people watching at Mario's, and the beer is out of this world.
author: Anne Marie F.

description: Met friends for lunch here yesterday and though I enjoyed the food and the company, I didn't get what the big deal was about these sandwiches.  Maybe if I'd had their signature sandwiches, Meatball, or Sausage, I would have had a better idea.  But, they were out of both.  So, I had the grilled chicken #2.  It was good, but, I've had just as good at other places for less money.  It's a great location, right across the street from the park, for people and dog watching, of which I enjoy.    However, I feel my friends hyped this place up too much.  So much so that my expectations were probably impossible to meet.
author: Magdalena ..

description: 4 stars for the really great location, atmosphere, and comfy setting.  However, the eggplant parmesana was disappointing but after reading the reviews sounds like the thing to order there are the sandwiches.  It's still a great cafe and I'll definitely be returning but will stick to the drinks and sandwiches...and of course desserts.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Another local treasure I'm prone to sit in for hours. Its really not about the food, its about the people. Its about the space, the place, the close proximity to Bimbo's. Its about people watching, and listening in (or joining in) on conversations and the bar is easy to lean against.
author: Jon F.

description: Love Mario's...i have been going here for years now. Usually to meet a friend who lives in north beach. I definitely agree with everyone the meatball sandwich is divine. So grab a samich and a glass of wine or beer and socialize with the crowd. It is a small place but feels more cozy than crowded.
author: Teddy d.

description: Solid. My favorite is the breaded eggplant sandwich with a glass of house red. Great place to meet up wtih friends for a quick bite before hitting the town. Cappucinos are tasty, too. Hits the spot on a sunny day, if you can get a window seat. The service used to be better a few years ago. Not sure the deal there. Could just be cluelessness or a decision by the staff to treat locals like passing tourists.
author: Trinity M.

description: Go with kids, be ignored.  This place thinks it's a lot more special than it is.  It's the only place I've ever left after being provided with menus.  There are about three dozen better places to go in North Beach.
author: Titus M.

description: I've spent way too much time in this little shop looking out onto washington square park!  My favorite table is the one in the very corner, looking out on both Columbus and Union Streets.  Get a focaccia sandwich - grilled chicken #2, meatball, veggie are all truly notable - and an italian soda.  Give yourself a while though - the customer service is friendly but lackadaisical.
author: Wendy M.

description: I spent the weekend sick as a dog.  Awful.  I managed to stumble down the block in search of sunshine and sustenance and made it as far as Mario's, where I almost collapsed onto a barstool.  The friendly guys behind the counter took good care of me, and within minutes I was set up with a copy of The Onion and an absolutely delectable chicken sandwich.  Sweet!  Thanks, Mario's, for letting this Typhoid Mary inhabit your joint.  I'll definitely be back.  (PS:  I tried really hard not to cough...I swear...)
author: Sheila W.

description: The panini here are fantastic. It's the perfect spot for a quick lunch or dinner. But let's be honest. There's a lot of other reasons they get 4 stars: the name, the view of Washington Square, Moretti Rosso in a bottle, the old North Beach bar. You can't go wrong at Mario's.
author: Dan B.

description: I MAKE my friends who live in San Francisco take me here when I visit.  For those of you who know how hideous the parking is in North Beach,  you KNOW this is a favor akin to Sophie making her "choice."  I won't wax, but their meatball sandwich makes me believe in God (and I mean capital "G").  I airship these to my father, they're that good.  I can't say more.  It's too intense.
author: Julie H.

description: I love this place, always have.  The staff makes us feel like we are family and they know to keep the wine coming.  Even if we got into a fist fight ( Hey, I said they are like family!) I'd still keep coming back and if they had more varieties of salad...I'd never leave.
author: Genevra P.

description: The lasagna here is the ultimate winter comfort food. Mario's is very cozy, with an old-fashioned San Francisco atmosphere. It's a good place for dates ... my parents had their first date here in the early 80s, and it's where I take a guy I'm seeing if I think he's really special. If the weather is nice, get an outdoor table facing Washington Square Park and people-watch. My only complaint is that service can be very slow. My friend and I were here for lunch once and waited almost 40 minutes for the check after we asked for it. I'll be forgiving since it was the day of the North Beach Jazz Festival, but that was really bad. Come for the food and the atmosphere.
author: Jane P.

description:
The first time I came here, I had the grilled chicken focaccia sandwich, and it was great, if not overpriced. I liked the jalapenos they threw in. However, the second time I ordered that sandwich, the chicken was super dry, and I had to throw away half of it. A few weeks later, I gave them another chance thinking it was a fluke. But again, the chicken in the third sandwich was gross and dry, and I couldn't even finish it.
If they start taking care of the food they prepare, I'd be back, but I'm not willing to risk another $10 to find out.
author: Mountbatten M.

description: I discovered this place 7 years ago when I lived in north beach and even though I live in the mission I still make it over there whenever I can. There is something about those foccacia bread sandwiches that is so delicious. I have taken many different people there and everybody has loved the food. The mini pizzas are tasty too. I could eat the chicken sandwich #2 everyday. The atmosphere is great and coffe is strong, and on a nice day/night you can sit outside. My favorite place in North Beach by a mile. Minus one star because the waitress with the big eyes is kind of rude.
author: Julian M.

description: This place is the bomb-diggity. Tasty morsels and all the right details when I want to go Italian and get my draft Anchor Steam.
author: Toome B.

description: I was really disappointed when I went there in late May. I used to go there back in the 80s and early 90s and the food was so much better. The focaccia is completely different from the recipe they used back then, when it was fresh, chewy, and delicious - this time is was a little overly crisp and the flavor was just not very good. My sausage sandwich was cold and not much better after I asked the guy to put it in the oven again (annoyance factor). My partner's meatball sandwich was...meh. The hipster dudes behind the bar seemed not that excited with their job. I won't be going back to spend my hard earned smacks when there's so much other good food in this city!
author: Otay B.

description: This is a fabulous little corner cafe in the heart of north beach. I love sitting outside on a hot day, sipping white wine and snacking on a delicious panini. The people-watching from this corner is great, as it is right across the street from Washington Park, and the food is wonderful. They cook it right inside at the bar in a large wood burning oven. The staff is kind and attentive. This place has a lot of character is a small, quaint, non-pretentious spot that doesn't ever feel touristy. Definitely check it out.
author: Emily L.

description:
delicious paninis, awesome cappucinos, and oh my god tiramisus...i'm drooling thinking about my wonderful lunch here yesterday.

the service is a little robotic, but as long as my food is good i'm going back!
author: cindy c.

description: Wonderful hot focaccia sandwiches.  It's great for take-out for a group - order 3 types of sandwiches, and cut them in fourths, so everyone can have a bite of the many kinds of tastiness - meatball, Italian combo, veggie with cheese.  Their kitchen is also open fairly late so you can go there after seeing a show at Cobb's for a late bite.
author: darla s.

description: All about the focaccia sandwiches. So good! Can be really slow sometimes, but absolutely worth the wait.  I really can't describe just how yummy it is.
author: Don H.

description: Mmmmmm.  Great staff, great food and great location makes for great times.  Perfect for lunch.
author: Marla L.

description:
i took the 30 bus back to work, but wanted to stop for some lunch.  i had my heart set on giordano bros for some sandwiches, but i friggin' missed the stop.  so i looked out the window and saw focaccia bread sandwiches scrawled on the window.  FOCACCIA!!! I LOVE FOCACCIA!

it was late afternoon and hardly crowded at all, but i swear could they have been any slower??  i was starving, and i did not enjoy the fact there was nothing else on the menu you could munch on along with the sandwich. minus one star.

i got my sausage with marinara and swiss focaccia sandwich, it smelled great and looked great, but for $10.00 including tax and tip.  UH... not so great.  i felt it was missing something, like a kick!  it was a bit bland, i was looking for lots of flavors on many levels.  it fell short. minus last star, BUT I Must say that the focaccia bread was delish!

maybe this place is more of a beer/wine joint.  i will not be returning.  i'd prolly go back to giordano bros a couple of blocks down if i were to get a sandwich in north beach. :) smiles tho
author: Janina U.

description: I first popped into this comfortable cafe while I was trying to avoid the drunken crowds on St. Patty's Day.  It is a great place to sip a coffee  while watching the pedestrian heavy streets of North Beach.  The table in the very corner of the wedge shaped cafe is the best seat in the house. Slip into this cozy spot on a cool and breezy San Francisco afternoon.
author: Alexis M.

description: I may be biased but I only ordered a Latte at this place. Why am I giving it four stars then? The coffee was perfect, the temperature was perfect (read: did not burn my lips) and the decor is funky. I'd go here to read a book if I lived in San Fran.
author: A T.

description: Try the chicken panini or the chicken focaccia. Delish. Small size coffee, not over priced. We'll be back for sure.
author: Bridey J.

description: Such a great San Francisco establishment.  Set right across the street from Washington Square Park with huge windows to watch over North Beach.  They have cheap wine and great focaccia sandwiches.  The kind of place you go and realize how great of a city San Francisco is.
author: Steven M.

description: Fantastic sandwiches, great neighborhood vibe, very friendly staff. I eat here at least once a week.
author: Ossama A.

description: Great bar for a casual bite. The wine is just okay but they make nice aperitifs too.  I recommend the grilled eggplant sandwich on foccacia bread (with balsamic vinaigrette, feta, tomato, arugula).
author: Meredith G.

description: My favorite cafe in north beach, tasty sandwiches, friendly service, good beer and wine, and no pretension.  Their focaccia sandwiches are the best!
author: Nolan E.

description: Came here with one of my new roommates as this is a favorite spot of his, and I have to say it was pretty good! Nestled in north beach, this Italian spot does a pretty good ceasar salad and we had something else resembling enchiladas stuffed with different fillings. Those were pretty good but I think next time I'm going for something a bit more my speed- sandwich or pasta or something (if they have those). Split a bottle of wine, which was great, and chatted with people at the next table after they overheard our conversation regarding my roommates slut of an ex-girlfriend. I really like the bathroom for some reason, which I think has to do with the slanted ceiling, like you're peeing in an attic. Check this place out, it's got a relaxed, local vibe with good people all around.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Great place for lunch. Had both the meatball and grilled eggplant on focaccia. Service wasn't the best and the place is very small, but ideal for a picnic in Wash square.
author: Ruby S.

description:
the meatball or eggplant sandwiches more than make up for any shortcomings in the service [stefano acts like an asshole to everbody, i learned to deal with it], even after a long hike over coit tower like on the day i discovered this place

take it to go or have it there, you'll have a view with the park and tel-hi only a few feet away

again, the best meatball and eggplant sandwiches in the city, with lots of great scenery and opportunities to people-watch
author: Charles C.

description: This place is the bomb-it does just what you want it to and doesn't tread into areas outside of their mastery. GREAT focaccia sandwiches, cheap vino, stupendous people-watching location, and wicked bad-breath inducing caeser. Eat your anchovies and kiss a stranger for a new twist!
author: National H.

description: Cozy, Euro and very friendly. Munch on the smoked turkey foccacia sandwich while downing the smooth house red wine and plan the revolution. If you need further fortification, try their tiramisu and cappuccinos.
author: Megan W.

description: Tasty inexpensive sandwiches on foccacia made from the tiniest sandwich station on the planet! Super good tho.  Can get pretty crowded.
author: Suzanne L.

description: Despite the name, there are no Cigars in use or on sale here. It's just a restaurant. And a damned good one. Try the meatball sandwich, quite delectable. Parking is a problem, but this is San Francisco, so I can't really complain about that too much. Prices are okay, a little high.
author: M W.

description: After hearing all the wonderful reviews and being one of the must eats by 7X7 magazine, I was disappointed.  I had their meatball sandwich and it was OK.  I do like how it was on focaccia bread.  But for $10 for an OK sized sandwich and no sides (those peppers do not count especially since I do not like peppers), it was not worth the money.  I do not know how this is only one $ when after tax and tip for only a sandwich it was still $13.  I would rather get 2 5-dollar footlongs at Subway.  At least that will fill me up.
author: A W.

description: Ohhh yeah snap into a beard. These guys ooze man-hood. never mind the the north biatch. a spicy meatball will satifies me. love the boys at maaarios.
author: marjorie v.

description: Great Focaccia in a small corner cafe of Litty Italy.
author: cynthia l.

description: This place is very nice. I love North Beach and all its cafes. After passing by this cafe many times, I never went in even though it looked alluring, but after hearing that they have the "best foccacia sandwiches" on Bay Area Backroads I decided to give it a go. I ordered the turkey foccacia with pepper jack cheese and onions, and I replaced the dijon mustard with red bell peppers. We sat outside and it was very comfortable, and the sandwiches came right away. Sadly, they don't carry "exotic" Torani flavors like coconut or mango, so I had to settle for a peach Italian soda. It was still yummy. The sandwich was very very tasty, nice crispy bread and great cheese.. kinda spicy too, which I liked. I had a bite of both the grilled eggplant and breaded eggplant sandwiches and they were awesome. A+
author: O K.

description: Come here if you want sandwiches and beer.  It's like a bar with tables, and without the TV.  This is the perfect Saturday lunch spot if you want to be able to just chill and get some quick food on the sorta cheap.  I live in the neighborhood, and hit it up at least twice a month.  The only food I can vouch for is the eggplant pannini and foccacia sandwich, both baked and breaded. Good stuff man, I think the arugala makes the difference... and that fine ass north beach bread.  My friends assure me that the dead animals they serve are consistently delicious as well.  Also, it's not too touristy, which is always a worry in North Beach.  They would get 4 stars but... at the end of a day it's only an eggplant sandwich,even if it is the best I have ever had. They would have to stuff that eggplant with truffles to get 5 stars from me.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
I have to admit that I'm not entirely comfortable stopping in by myself at most sit-down restaurants when on American soil.  

But I've done just that at Mario's.  Twice.

Maybe I'm at ease dining sola at Mario's because it's so traditionally Italian I think I'm really in Napoli?  Or because it's friendly, and unassuming, and more casual (read: less pushy) than other North Beach trattorias? Whatever the reason behind my newfound homeland confidence, I'm happy to say that the times I have sat at their bar--all by myself--with the newspaper, a panini, and a glass of vino, have been two of my most pleasant and relaxing North Beach memories.
author: Hannah J.

description:
yummy yummy yummy. i love Mario's. it is everything good about San Francisco rolled into one place...mellow people, great food, wonderful neighborhood. this is why i love my hometown...

try the meatball sandwich:)
author: carolyn h.

description: Tucked in a corner in the heart of North Beach, this is purely a San Francisco experience and great for people watching. You can't go wrong with any of the Focaccia and Panini sandwiches at this old Italian North Beach institution. Coffee is good and strong. Hit and miss on getting in as space is very cramped in this wedge shaped venue. Best to go at an off time.
author: Arlene C.

description: Great foccaccia sandwiches, with a good vegetarian option.  Bottles of wine are $21, which is also nice.  Not the best wine in the world, but what do you expect for $21.  They also have house wine for cheaper.  Has a good local feel to it, despite the location.  Sitting outside is great.
author: Karla R.

description: Excellent Panini sandwitches and a good Italian wine list.  The Italian sodas here are certainly the bomb, and the sandwitches, oh the sandwitches, all warm and gooey and toasted perfectly on their old school panino press...Try the turkey, which is always one of my favorites...This place is quite small and can get quite cramped with all of the tourists of north beach, but the wait and the tight quarters is worth it once you bite into one of those darling sandwitches...
author: Francis K.

description: Between three and four stars and pushing the culinary limits of what's possible with a glorified toaster oven. Mario's limited menu is consistently decent and they do panini, focaccia and small thin sliced pizza well. Good place for a simple meal, beer or wine, or coffee drink. Check out the photos on the wall of the family, including the original owner excelling in bocce ball and looking like the Soprano's Feech LaManna and son who is a dead ringer for ex Pittsburgh Steelers head coach Bill Cowher. A fine and authentic, low key, North Beach vibe.
author: R M.

description: I just love this place.  It is true to itself: a cozy, local neighborhood joint that has been around for decades and serves up non-fancy fare at decent prices.  No, it won't be the best meal you've eaten, but it will be reasonably priced and fill you up.  A great place to meet friends for a casual low-key impromptu dinner.  We don't have nearly enough places like Mario's in SF these days.
author: GirlAtTheCafe N.

description: When I lived in the neighborhood, this was my never fail go-to spot.  A small corner space with windows looking out onto Washington Square Park, a comfortable place to sit and drink wine and talk for hours.  I'm partial to the cannelloni that comes bubbling from the small counter oven.
author: Jon P.

description: I brought an out of town friend here, and it was cold inside, my tea was so-so, and the food wasn't too impressive.  But it's a great place to sit and enjoy the view of the Washington Square.
author: Anya B.

description: Meatball Sandwich to die for...: Went for a lunch of the meatball sandwich and an iced tea. Handsome waiter that I made smile and the sandwich truly surprised me. The meatballs are cut in half and packed tightly in sauce and cheese between triangles of foccacia bread. Got quite a bit of writing done and had a great view of a guy playing Frisbee with his son in the park.
author: Jo S.

description: intimate feel, fast service, the menu is simple an straight to the point, all components to a good spot. I had the tuna sandwich here today, definitely worth it. Stop by have a Peroni on me.
author: Joe J.

description: The first bar I went to when I moved here four years ago.  I will never forget Amor, Nelson and Heiyme (sp?) = the bartenders.  You want a mellow, chill night? Get drunk and enjoy a salad and paninni at Mario's
author: Laura J.

description: This was my first visit to Mario's. I tried this place on a whim and was very impressed. I ordered the Combo sandwich which was perfectly toasted. I also ordered a glass of wine to go along. Thanks Marios
author: Peterson H.

description: My most favorite place to eat in North Beach!!!  The best panini's i've ever had! They also make wonderful lattes. Just a simple little restaurant that serves great food and provides a relaxing environment.  You can't go wrong at Mario's.
author: Ruby H.

description: i know this place for more than 4 years.Nice food ( sandwiches )  , kinda slow but friendly service .It's quite European style ,nice view, tasty wine...i recommended...
author: Ozzy D.

description: I really like this place.  There are no cigars, just hip party kids who can give a shit about you. That's what makes it charming though. Oh and the raggae constantly playing puts me in a good mood.  The food is also great and it's a nice place to have a pint on a Saturday afternoon.  Just steer clear of the coffee.
author: Matt B.

description:
I went here with my Girlfriend the other day. The atmosphere in here is amazing. We were lucky enough to get a table right when we walked in despite it being quite crowded.
The waitress that was serving us was a little slow, but at the end of our visit she had totally redeemed herself.
I ordered the Combo sandwich, which comes with Swiss Cheese, salami, ham, mustard and mayonaise. She got the sausage sandwich which is served open faced. She also purchased a Salad but that did not arriave. The sandwiches we had were very good. I ordered an Anchor Steam off the tap, and she got a Coffee. The cup seemed a little small and the waitress forgot the cream. When we were getting ready to leave and asked for the check we mentioned the salad never arriaved. Appologizing she gave my girlfriend a free Biscotti and Coffee which made up for the lack of salad. All around our experience was good. Had the service been better it may have been pretty amazing.
author: Mark C.

description: This place was fantastic! My Bf and I just got back and I am beaming Im so satisfied. He ordered the chicken panini and ordered half of a grilled eggplant and vinagerette sandwich. For $5 is was huge! And the best $5 ever spent. It was cozy, busy and we barely got a table but it was close to our new house and we've always wanted to try it. Im so impressed by this place! Good coffee, no soy milk though, kind of a bummer, so I had an italian soda which was delicious.
author: Jenna R.

description: Ciao! I love the chicken sandwich #1 with a Peroni, Anchor or a glass of Montepulciano!  Buona Sera!
author: Adam P.

description: if you are looking a great sandwich, Mario's got it.  It has the best paninis and other baked dishes.  although food comes rather slow given the number of customers the two cooks serve.
author: Shirl L.

description: Tasty sandwiches!  We had the meatball foccacia sandwich and a salad.  The foccacia was toasted to perfection and the meatballs were perfectly seasoned.  Yum-O as Rachael Ray likes to say.  (Okay, she totally bugs.)   The salad was good too, but nothing to write home about.  The waitstaff seemed quirky, but very friendly.
author: Tory Q.

description: Classic, friendly neighborhood spot. There are always a bunch of regulars at the bar. Their open-faced, hot foccacia sandwiches are delicious and I love how their wine is served in carafes. The staff is extremely cool and efficient. One of my favorite neighborhood cafes.
author: Laura Gardner S.

description:
oh my god!  the combo changed my life.  and i only had 4 bites.  the sandwich was rich, cheesey, hot and yummy.

mmmmmm!

can't stop thinking about it.  can't wait to eat a whole one....or two.
author: Sierra D.

description: I discovered this perfect little cafe the moment I arrived in San Francisco over a year ago now. It has served as my favorite hide-a-way in North Beach. I do my writing here as I enjoy a glass of wine and a macchiato. Ah balance.
author: Jamie K.

description:
I have passed Mario's for years but never went in.  After finding them in Zagat's, my husband and I finally tried it.

Great sandwiches--I had the meatball and my husband had the vegetable.  Both were excellent.  We split a Caeser Salad and it was as good.  

Service is a little slow, though, so make sure you go when you have some time.
author: Karen B.

description: i've been coming to mario's since 1994.  it's one of those places where time basically stands still.  it's old school like that.  the decor, the attitude of the folks working there, the patrons...it's got that no b.s., no fronting vibe that only a few north beach spots still have nowadays.  and it's not obsolete in any way.  what worked so well then still holds up today.  excellent paninis.  solid coffee drinks.  inexpensive, not cheap, wine served in gibraltar glasses.  music plays at a volume level that allows for conversation.  bartenders/baristas/servers are attentive and friendly, but without any fake friendly that so frequently passes for customer service nowadays.  the cafe gets great light and is a fantastic place to while away an afternoon.
author: Rob P.

description: This place is a great stop for lunch or a light dinner.  With one tiny oven and a panini press they manage to crank out some delicious sandwiches (I always get a half of chicken #2 and have never been disappointed).  Friendly service and really inexpensive (albeit mediocre) wines by the glass.
author: Amy K.

description: This would be a long, glowing review if I ordered more than one thing over and over and over and over again--"The Combo" focaccia sandwich. The best hot club you can join.
author: Julia W.

description: This is a fun place to just hang out and their sandwiches are the best. They use foccacia bread (very yummy). We had the #1 chicken sandwich and the combo. The sausage and the meatball sandwiches are also very delicious. Great No beach hangout!
author: Jay S.

description: So this is truly a San Francisco classic, the sandwiches are great on Focaccia from Liguria.  Sausage and the breaded eggplant sandwiches are the two best.  Try a house campari, they rock.  The pizza's aren't bad either.  It is a world class cafe.  Prices are reasonable, look to spend about $15 a person.
author: Mickey D.

description:
Good coffee, good food, good atmosphere, good location.

I wish they had more outdoor tables.

I disagree with the info on Yelp about this place that says it isn't good for kids.  I see babies and kids here with parents frequently and they all seem to be having a fine time.
author: Slim B.

description: Definitely one of my top 5 favorite places in North Beach. Lovely staff and great food in the perfect atmosphere. Their grilled eggplant sandwich is to die for, I can't let one week pass without having one. Best place to go before hitting the strip-clubs!
author: Juan d.

description: House Campari.  Four bucks.  Best cocktail deal in North Beach.
author: Counter C.

description: I can't believe it took me a full year of living in North Beach before discovering Mario's!  The foccacia sandwiches are the bomb.  I just sampled a troika -- one meatball, one sausage, and one grilled eggplant.  The all important foundation -- the foccacia itself -- is superb.  I assume it comes from Liguria Bakery just on the other side of Washington Square.  Each of the main events -- the meatball, sausage and egglplant, respectively -- were fantastically flavorful.  Subtly spicy, sliced thin, topped with just right the condiments.  Minus one star for somewhat slow service (how long can it take to assemble a sandwich) and a slightly dingy feel to the place (dripping-stained menus).
author: Charlie Z.

description: Awesome place to grab a tasty sandwich. By now I've tried everything on the menu and have not been disappointed. Come early if you want to catch a seat outside, or just walk across the street to the park. Hot sandwich, italian soda, a good espresso after... Perfection!
author: Gene F.

description: I love everything about Mario's. I love the meatball sandwich (and cesar salad), I love the cappuccino, I love the bizarre Balkan pop music, I love the ambience, I love the adorable staff. I *love* the carrot cake. Honey, sweetheart, Mario's, please don't ever change.
author: Ell B.

description: very fun atmosphere and good food.  very casual.  one of the better places to go in north beach, it has been there forever.
author: Eb M.

description: You will never go wrong with a meatball sandwich--or with the breaded eggplant sandwich--accompanied by a glass of chianti at Marios.  Its the atmosphere that puts it over the top, right on the corner off Washington Square, watching all the local color and enjoying a bit of old time North Beach ambiance.
author: David T.

description: less than 5 stars?  really?  kick you in the shins and make you live in cleveland.
author: Michael H.

description: this place makes consistently great sandwiches on focaccia bread however don't go for the service.  they have been known to be brusque.
author: Dorothy L.

description: I love this tiny cafe. Not only does it have a great location by the park/good food/cozy atmosphere/nice-though-not-hovering-servers, but it plays reggae music. And I enjoy listening to Bob Marley when I eat eggplant sandwiches.
author: Sora O.

description: I saw this place reviewed on Check Please Bay Area, and thought it was worth checking out. Perhaps if you're a regular you'll get decent service. Our waiter made us wait way too long at every step along the way. I had a Panini that was ok and the atmosphere/location are good. I'd go back if the service wasn't so bad.
author: V M.

description: Go there Saturday to sit outside, watch people at Washington square park, have a beer, maybe even a great sandwich. Pay next to nothing, yelp about it and come back next week.
author: Hratch P.

description: This place is better than an average sandwich joint and beats the Subway 5 for 5 for sure.  I once did an engagement photo session here since the couple met here and that was fun!  It is charming and service great and truly good food.
author: Misti L.

description: happened upon this neighborhood mainstay.  got the meatball sammy on focaccia.  it was delicious!!!  get it.  you won't be sorry.
author: Sharlene C.

description: molto bene!  my mozzerella/tomato/pesto panini hit the spot and i enjoyed the cozy atmosphere of the bar area.  plus, i was transported to and from mario's via scooter, which only served to complete my italian moment.  grazie mille!
author: ali l.

description: after two years, and all my hangouts either closed, changed hands, or whatever ... good coffee, warm surroundings, and decent snacks
author: tim y.

description: mario's is pretty cool.  no cigars here, but a very nice location serving good coffee, tiramisu, and hot sandwiches and pizza.  my favorite:  an anchor steam, a cappuccino, and tiramisu in the afternoon.  if it's warm enough, i'll take a seat on the sidewalk on the North side of the shop, which is fully shaded during the day.
author: Spencer W.

description: This is a lovely little cafe for lunch, the sandwiches are great!  I highly recommend  the eggplant panini.  The cafe is pretty small, so if you want to get in it's best to go during "off" hours.  All and all, this is a great place.
author: Melanie R.

description: not only do they have an excellent name, these sandwiches rival molinari's (huge, packed with whatever of your heart's delight, and toasted) and its stellar location right on the square is a great place to watch the bums try to con tourists. they also have a short menu of more dinner-oriented items, but i haven't tried them yet.
author: Jenz y.

description: great focaccia bread sanwiches. the grilled chicken #1 and #2 are excellent as well as the turkey and the combo. great location for north beach people watching, especially if you get a seat looking toward washington square.
author: Dean E.

description: This is probably one of my favorite places in the 'tourist' friendly North Beach.  Most places in North Beach don't need to keep up to par because they know they will have plenty of Union Square'ites visiting them.  The thinng that is cool about Marios is that is has a local feel and the food/drink are simple but good.  The menu is limited and they cook all their food out of an oven the size of a dishwasher.  The beer is always cold and fresh.  The wine is always cheap and tasty.  Great little place to take something to read and eat solo.
author: Chris C.

description: This place has some of the best paninis and focaccia sandwiches!  I love to sit at the bar and look at the old pictures or outside on the sidewalk overlooking Washington Square Park and have a beer while I wait for my sandwich.  Everytime a friend of mine comes to visit, she requests we come here.  If you are in a rush or one of those people that can't chill and enjoy a good atmosphere while you wait for your food, do not come here if there are a lot of people.  It is a small, casual, corner joint and they have room for just one oven and one person to make the food - but that is personally what I love about it!
author: Ashley A.

description: I love this place! it really reminds me of a cafe in Madrid i went to years ago. It has a cool european feel and if you're lucky to get a window seat, looking out at the park is really something! The paninis are very good. Especially the grilled chicken #1. I take everyone who comes into town here. I tell them its not chic, not fancy but a cool typical north beach hang out.  They're never disappointed. Its not very touristy and I think every time im there i see someone whom ive seen eaten there before. The service is a weee slow but i dont mind it since its a kick back place and why would you want to rush to get out of there! The music they play is usually very cool.  Highly recommend it!
author: Jesse O.

description: it pains me to give mario's a glowing review b/c i want to be able to grab a seat next time i go by.  cram yourself into a tiny table inside, belly up to the bar, or brave the san francisco weather at one of the outdoor seats with a view of columbus ave and washington square park.  order a seriously delicious sandwich and watch your quality of life improve instantly.  years ago i sat at one of the tight little tables  (in the pointy corner of the store where columbus ave meets union st)  with my then friend and now husband.  cozy spaces are seriously romantic (at any time of day).  my girlfriend's have told me of "special moments" with a date here.  it must be the no-pressure, un-assuming atmoshphere that allows people to relax with each other.  the only downside for me is that the coffee is lack luster.  i know mario's gets it's coffee from the local coffee roaster (so it's super fresh) but it's not quite as good as you get from some of the other coffee bars in the neighborhood (there's no shortage).  maybe their machine needs to be "calibrated" or tweeked, i should give it another try.  it's worth it.
author: passion f.
